author: HQuiff
title: I don't think "A Building Experience" is included?!
review:
If you're a LEGO Fan, or a Kid, then I would recommend this to you, however if you are an Adult who has no experience with LEGO, don't let your Kid(s) force you into watching this.
First off, the Humor included is laden with LEGO Puns, and Jokes, not to mention the plot. Most references and Cameos are only appealing if you like, or collect, LEGO! Simple as. 

The Voice actors (And Actresses) surprised me a great deal. The Atlantis film was poor and overrated, however this is arguably a quite enjoyable film. Clutch himself doesn't put much emotion into his character, but then again there isn't much emotion in this. By far the most outstanding fellow is played by the current LEGO Owner, Kjeld Krik Kristenson (KKK), however the characters name escapes me at this moment.

Now for everyone's favourite, it's...
Pro(s):
1. Good voice acting, especially in comparison to past LEGO films.
2. True to LEGO! It uses all the principles of LEGO, often reminding you of what LEGO was always meant to be, and how it still is in some areas.
3. A lot of the puns used are actually quite funny.
4. Storyline was well-paced.
5. Good CGI
6. Great editing, and sound too.

Onto to everybody's least favourite, it's...
Con(s):
1. Clutch's voice actor lacked emotion.
2. Not an all around movie for the whole audience.
3. Tad expensive.
4. Focused too much on Castle
5. Typical Characters
6. Some if the guys were very pretentious

And there you have it! My five part review on the all new DVD Movie - Clutch Powers! Hope you enjoyed it. I recommend it to most LEGO fans, and to Kids.
HQuiff

author: Paradoxymoron
title: Great movie
review:
Personally, I really liked this movie. I found it to be a lot better than the four Bionicle movies, and I'm actually hoping that a sequel (which I believe will be inevitable) will be made. I also liked the puns, some of which I didn't catch until I watched it a second time with subtitles turned on (Which I recommend highly). There were a few references to Star Wars and Indiana Jones in it, along with others I probably missed.

Pros:

  • Several themes used/shown (Castle, City, Power Miners, Agents, Mars Mission (Kind of), Space Police)
  • Creativity with LEGO pieces is well shown. Several things are built out of them.
  • References
  • Puns
  • Good story
  • Skeletons add extra humor at points where the plot is a little more serious
  • I personally liked the idea behind the 'creation spark'

Cons:

  • The minifigs' body parts fall off/rotate. I.e. Bernie spins his head around 360 degrees in one scene and Brick's hand comes off in another. I really didn't like this, but that might just be me
  • The strength of LEGO pieces is not only overestimated but underestimated as well. I.e. The troll crashes into the giant LEGO wall without doing any damage, yet he pushes it and it falls over.
  • Some themes used are discontinued. Hope this means that in the inevitable sequel there will be more recent themes.
  • Once they went after the wizard, they just kind of completely forgot about the other two escaped prisoners (although, this is one of the reasons I think there will be a sequel)
  • The line from the trailer "Once again Clutch Powers single-handedly gets the job done!" was not in the movie. Darn.

I'm still trying to figure out what Clutch Powers' name might have to do with LEGO, but the other characters' names obviously are meant to be associated with LEGO. Names like Bernie Von Beam, Peg Mooring, and Brick Masterson. Also of note, are the characters named Kjeld Playwell and Artie Fol.

Eerex

author: I_like_Lego
title: A Great Movie!
review:
Intro

The Adventures of Clutch Powers is a great Movie! First, because of the Fast Story, and Second, I got it for $14.83 Canadian! Not Even 15 Dollars! And there wasn't even a sale on! Good 'ol Wal-Mart. Anyway, here's how I got it:
javascript:void(0);
"I went to my Wal Mart Supercenter (The Same Wal-Mart I picked up Separatist Shuttle) to pick up Buttery Popcorn. I saw the Cube shaped DVD rack, and Saw Clutch Powers (it was the last one there). I later went over to check the price, and it was $14.83. Later, I picked it up, and my Sibling held it (I was holding the Box of Popcorn). We bought everything, and proceeded out."

I didn't get to watch it till the next day (Saturday) since it was 8:00, and the Sun was Setting here in Canada.

Review

The Movie has a very fast Story, and the Animation is great. It feature a lot of Sets from Original Lego Themes, and Star Wars references. The Intro was very good, and the Baby Rock Monster is adorable.

The Movie has great Characters (Hogar, Leloaf, Omega, Clutch), and Great Locations. A lot of the Jokes weren't that funny (Except the Lucky Socks joke). The Battle was great, and the ending of the Battle had a reference to Star Wars. Skelly and Bones were also partly funny (like the part about Brick Built Minifig underneath the trap).

The Special features are also  really great. The "Bad Hair day" featurete was really good. The "Mini Toys" Featurete was also great, since it includes the 6 Space Police 3 Movie Logs, and the Power Miners CGI Movie. "TV Spot" was also really good, since they show the Ads for Atlantis, Power Miners and Space Police 3 in better quality.

Pros

Great Characters
Great use of Vehicles
Great Scenes
Great Animation
Great Story
Great Special Features
Music is Good
Credits are Great

Cons


None!

Overall: 5/5. Great Movie! Try to get it. You'll really enjoy it! Thanks for Reading!

author: SgtSmash
title: A fun little movie for the little Lego lover in your life
review:
I really had no intention of buying the Clutch Powers DVD, especially once I saw The Lego Store at the Mall Of America was selling it for $19.99 USD. However, Toys R' US had it on sale for $11.99, so on an impulse I bought it for my daughter and I to enjoy.

 

It's a fun little movie, with some colorful characters interacting with many current Lego themes. (Spoilers ahead) The film starts out with super-agent Clutch trying to recover a Power Crystal using the Power Miners equipment, which quickly jumps to Clutch speeding towards HQ in Lego City in the "Turbocar Chase" sports car from the sadly now-defunct Agents line. Clutch tears up the town for about 30 seconds, with several landmark City sets (Police and Fire stations, Carousel, Town Plan movie theater...etc.) visible, before meeting up with his new team consisting of 3 partners to board a Space Police spaceship, zipping to a prison planet to face the mastermind criminal (an evil wizard). Ultimately, Clutch and Co. help usurp the evil wizard which has taken over another world where a prince earns his rightful spot as king (Lego Castles sets).  

 

The film is directed at kids, with a few inside jokes for adult collectors (the gadget developer/mad scientist at HQ is named Artie Fol...or A.FOL for short). Brick Masterson (the fireman/weapons/demolition) expert is the funnest character IMHO. Clutch Powers himself is kind of a dud of a character, with zero personality aside from his reputation for being the greatest Lego builder of all time. The person that voices Clutch sounds like he took valium before phoning in his performance. I know children's direct-to-video films aren't supposed to have Oscar-worthy performances, but there are many parents like myself that screen or watch movies with their kids, at least make it somewhat entertaining for them too! I fell asleep after about the first 45 minutes, but my daughter has watched it about 6-7 times since, so it was worth the $11.99. 


I was a bit disappointed there wasn't more interaction with the City sets, but again, it's for kids, not for me!

author: collectormom
title: A GREAT movie for kids
review:
I got this movie for my 3 & 4 years olds and they just loved it. The story was interesting to them and they liked being able to pick out the Lego sets they have. Some of the humor was above them but I think it was meant more for adults (at their age they didn't pick up the Star Wars references).

The only thing I wish they did was include a Clutch Powers minifig with the movie; now I have to create one

author: PdxPhoenix
title: Better than I expected
review:
I saw it in the store one day & picked it up. While I haven't seen any of the other movies as I'm not really interested in those themes, but I thought "how bad could be?"

I was quite surprised at how well it was done, from the quality of the story to the quality of the production. Yes it was funny and punny, but at least in a good way. Though I can't say I noticed that Clutch was wooden(-?) or that the Aussie character didn't have a convincing accent. I look forward to the sequel that it set itself up for.

To address a couple of points mentioned previously:

Of course it's a bit commercial... it is, in a way, one long commercial for their products ... just too bad that some of the themes aren't in production any more.

-and-

FYI "Clutch Power" is what The LEGO Group refers to as how well the bricks grip each other... New bricks have really good clutch power; older bricks maybe not so much.

author: James_Skywalker
title: Hyperdrives and wizards? Must be a Lego film.
review:
At last a Lego product that's good value for money. My six year old loves this and has watched it every day since we bought it a week ago. What's really great is that my son watches this and then goes to play with his Lego, thus taking him away from the TV for several hours.

 

I only have one issue with this film. Why release what is basically an hour and a half long commercial for Lego sets when most of the sets are no longer in production? I've managed to acquire one of the sets off E-bay (at an inflated price) and another from bricklink (in bits and pieces). Come on Lego I'd rather give my hard earned cash to you instead of some hoarder on E-bay

 

Lego's marketing department want a real kick up the backside, they've missed the boats on: the Clone Wars, sets not released until six months after the film; Lego Batman, video game comes out and sets sell out before Christmas (when my son got the game); Lego Harry Potter, the video games out but the sets aren't, delayed for the film release no doubt.

its funny at some parts and keeps you laughing. with a chuckle every 5 minutes. just right to keep the story and the humor (if you have only jokes the story isn't relistic) the two skellys are hillarius. thet're evil but you still like them. brick whats-his-face is really funny and is the most elaboret charector. overall a great movie!
P.S. Revet and Mallock? come on lego were not stupid. so i guess its JUST a counsidence that in SW knight of the old republic the two main charectors are,''Reven and Malak?"

author: Odeinoichus
title: LEGO's First Official Motion Picture.
review:
Set #2854298 LEGO The Adventures of Clutch Powers: Before teaming up with Warner Brothers for most of their LEGO animation projects, LEGO made this little known or discussed gem with Universal. Advertised as The First LEGO Movie on DVD, The Adventures of Clutch Powers is the first of many specials and feature films to come. I feel as if there were other story ideas before Clutch Powers, but those may have just been PC Games like Island Extreme Stunts. The quality of the animation proves it is older than most series.

Presentation

The front of the package showcases the titular character of Clutch Powers front and center. The rest of the main cast are also visible, do not ask me their names, I watched this a few months back and as I type the review now I recall precious little of the characters names. The back has a decent selection of shots, a good write-up on the storyline and that’s about it. The disc does not feature any characters, no artwork at all.

Minifigures

This release did not include bonus Minifigures. That did not start until the first DC Feature release, so sadly there are no bonus items with the film.

Contents

The film itself is almost an hour and a half and definitely has the markings of a pilot film. Almost as if LEGO intended to make this into a series, unfortunately the plot wraps up only part of the storyline. I’m not sure if LEGO online ever featured any further adventures, but the story kind of ends a bit on a stalled ending. The basic premise is that three of the LEGO world’s worst villains have escaped and Clutch Powers and his team needs to work together to recapture them.

Spoilers, they don’t get along very well. In point of fact this plot is pretty standard fare. Once they manage to thwart and capture one of the villains, the others are still at large. Overall it’s a decent film, quite entertaining, and as a bonus there is an extra small short included which features some of the characters.

The animation is quite dated, considering it is now 10 years old that is to be expected. The storyline features some ideas that did not return, and others that were referenced in other LEGO projects, I’m pretty certain Ninjago, The LEGO Movie and even some of the Bionicle/Hero Factory stories featured some references to major ideas introduced here. The term master building or master builder was mentioned in passing here.

Overall opinion

A pretty decent and engaging piece of LEGO media history with this item. The fact that there aren’t a lot of bonus materials to watch or enjoy along with it does mean that you don’t get a whole lot to do after watching the film. Would I recommend this film? Hard to say, if you can find it and want to see LEGO’s first feature at a good price, it is worth tracking down. If you’d prefer to ignore the character then it is safely skippable. So somewhat recommended.

author: TooMuchLEGO
title: Fun for all ages
review:
I remember getting this for my birthday back in March 2010. Me and my friend watched it and really enjoyed it. The film does a good job of keeping the audience happy and it has some nice LEGO "cameos" (if I could call them that)- for instance, Clutch's car happens to be the Agents turbo car, and in the Power Miners segment, Clutch keeps himself alive by battling a rock monster with the Power Miners mine mech, and even LEGO MINDSTORMS makes an appearance.
The film altogether is great- it has good voice acting, a nice plot, and it's just incredible to see all the cool LEGO characters walk around all animated.
Unfortunately, there were some faults in the movie- for instance, I found it focused WAY too much on Castle. It shows Power Miners for 10 min, City for like 2, and Space for like 5. As for Castle, there's about an HOUR of that. Personally I would've liked some more variety.
Overall however, it's a great movie, and any LEGO fan, big or small, will enjoy it.

author: SKip_E_Productions2
title: AMAZING film, I can see a sequel!
review:
"lego: the adventures of clutch powers" is a hiliariously good family film for both lego fans and lego haters! although it's not very "action-packed" until the last thirty minutes, it shows that a lot of hard work was put into it. i wish that the ending was different though. instead of fighting mallock on ashlar, why didn't mallock (the bad guy) fly to lego city too and summon another skeleton army there? then everyone would run and scream, and the lego team and prince varen would fly to lego city and save everyone. although that wasn't the ending, at least it's enjoyable to watch again and again.

 

worth the money! buy it!

author: Mr__Thrawn
title: Classic
review:
LEGO: The Adventures of Clutch Powers is not a very good film- the 2010 animated offering wouldn't quite make the AFI 100 list. The animation is simple, the voice acting competent but bland, and the script so formulaic one could be forgiven for thinking it had been written by a computer. I still love it, though. The DVD sits on my shelf alongside my Criterion Collection Blu-Rays of Eraserhead, The Grand Budapest Hotel, and other classic films. The stupid jokes still make me laugh. It's fun to recognize the LEGO sets featured (advertised). Skelly and Bones are fun characters. It's really quite good for a 90-minute toy ad, fairly engaging and fun to watch.

The DVD looks good enough, and has a nice selection of special features. There's a fun little short film featuring some of the main feature's characters, some cool stop-motion shorts (ads) for Space Police, a CG animated short (ad) for Power Miners, and some TV spots for those lines and Atlantis. It's not Citizen Kane, it's not even Aquaman, but Clutch Powers is still a lot of fun. I'll gladly watch it any chance I get.
